caption:
This photograph captures a close-up view focused primarily on a bird’s nest, which is intricately constructed using a variety of small sticks and twigs. In the nest, there are two pale blue eggs situated adjacent to a newly hatched, featherless bird. The bird appears very young, with sparse, fluffy down and its head is turned slightly upwards as if eagerly anticipating feeding or the return of a parent.

The backdrop of the nest scene is softly blurred which suggests the use of a shallow depth of field. Through this dissolve of focus, one can discern green leaves and patches of a white bright sky in the distance, highlighting that the nest is likely positioned among branches high up in a tree. The overall atmosphere, captured through the natural light filtering through foliage, gives a sense of serene natural environment—a safe and secluded spot for nesting. The lighting is soft and diffuse, suggesting an overcast sky or a shaded location, ideal for the protective ambiance of nestlings.
title: Baby pelican and eggs in nest
